revised_title: A Study of the Sting of the New Zealand Nettle, Urtica ferox
tldr: The study examines the properties of the sting of the New Zealand nettle, Urtica ferox, and its effects on isolated frog rectus abdominis muscles. The research discovers that the sting is caused by substances similar to acetylcholine and histamine, as well as a disturbance in calcium metabolism. The study also finds that the sting's potency is due to a yet-unknown substance, possibly from the guanidine group of compounds.
